see, seasons, spring, summer, fall, winter, flowers, hot, leaves, snow, play

Do the action for summer (wave hand like it is hot), fall (hands moving down to show leaves falling), winter (hug yourself like it is cold), spring (circle the flowers) and have the students circle one season at a time.

The teacher should use a puppet and ask the puppet, “What season is this?” by putting her hands up in an “I don’t know,” gesture. The teacher should answer the puppet, “This season is fall.”
The teacher should then ask the student
, “What season is this?” Encourage the child to answer by gesturing to them and putting your hand to your ear. The child should answer, “This season is fall.” Repeat the puppet activity if necessary.

The teacher should use a puppet and ask the puppet, “What season is this?” by putting her hands up in an “I don’t know,” gesture. The teacher should answer the puppet, “This season is winter.” The teacher should then ask the student, “What season is this?” Encourage the child to answer by gesturing to them and putting your hand to your ear. The child should answer, “This season is winter.” Repeat the puppet activity if necessary.

The teacher should answer the puppet, “This season is summer.” The teacher should then ask the student, “What season is this?” Encourage the child to answer by gesturing to them and putting your hand to your ear. The child should answer, “This season is summer.” Repeat the puppet activity if necessary.
